attributes.action: Instruct bus and train operators to switch off their engines when not in use
attributes.additional_details:
Trains  left standing  without a driver  but with the engine  left running  at station platforms  are consuming precious  fuel resources,  and also causing un neccesary pollution.

Equally  bus engines are frequently left  running  while the driver is  having  a tea or ciggarette break   or just  left  at a terminus   for  the next driver to  take over.

Millions of litres of fuel  are being wasted  by  bus and train  operators   by these  practices.

Therefore please  instruct operators   to save fuel  by switching off engines  for periods   of idleness,  and also when  left without a driver  at the wheel
